* Represents the main class for Luna, a task management chatbot.
* It initializes the necessary components and runs the command loop.
* Handles file storage operations for tasks.
* Parses user commands and converts them into executable commands.
* Initializes UI, storage, and parser components, and loads tasks from storage.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* Runs the main event loop of Luna.
* Continuously reads user input, processes commands, and executes them until exit.
* The main entry point of Luna.
* Creates an instance of Luna and starts the application.
* Represents an exception specific to the Luna application.
* This exception is used to handle errors related to invalid user input or command execution.

* Error type for incorrect command formats.

INVALID_TASK_NUMBER("Check the task number again to make sure it's correct~"),

* Constructs an ErrorType with a predefined message.
* @param message The error message associated with the error type.
* Retrieves the formatted error message by appending additional specific details.
* @param specificMessage Additional information regarding the specific error.
* @return A detailed error message including the general and specific error descriptions.
* Constructs a LunaException with a specified error type and a detailed message.
* @param errorType       The category of the error.
* @param specificMessage Additional details regarding the error.

* @throws LunaException If the input does not match any recognized commands.
public Command parse(String userInput) throws LunaException {

* Executes the AddCommand by adding the parsed task to the task list and saving it.
* @param tasks   The task list to which the new task will be added.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save tasks to file.
* @throws LunaException If an error occurs while executing the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LunaException {
System.out.println("Got it~ I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.getTasks().size() + " tasks in the list!!");
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed on the task list.
* All commands should extend this class and implement the execute method.
* Executes the command with the given task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to modify.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save changes.
* @throws LunaException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LunaException;
* Determines whether this command should terminate the application.
* @return {@code true} if the command should exit the application, {@code false} otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a specific task or all tasks from the task list.
private final Integer index; // Can be null if "all" is used
* @param input The user input specifying which task to delete or if all tasks should be deleted.
* @throws LunaException If the format is invalid or the task number is not a valid integer.
"Correct format for delete is `delete <task number>` or `delete all`");
"Correct format for delete is `delete <task number>` or `delete all`");
* Executes the delete command, removing either a specific task or all tasks from the list.
* @param tasks   The task list to modify.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save changes.
* @throws LunaException If there are no tasks to delete or if the task index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LunaException {
System.out.println("Now you have 0 tasks left in the list~");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.getTasks().size() + " tasks left in the list~");
* Represents a command that exits the application.

* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @param ui      The user interface to display results.
* @param storage The storage handler (unused in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to list all tasks.
* Executes the list command, displaying all tasks in the task list.

* @param storage Storage handler (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* @param input User input containing the command and task number.
* @param tasks   Task list containing the task to be marked.
* @param ui      User interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage Storage handler for saving updated task list.
* @throws LunaException If the task number is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LunaException {
System.out.println("Yay!~ I've marked this task as done:");
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not done.

* @param storage Storage handler for saving updated task list.
* @throws LunaException If the task number is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LunaException {
